page.title: 02SCHOOL
page.content: THE SCHOOL IS SITUATED ON A KNOLL SURROUNDED BY LIME, ELM, OAK, & LARCH TREES. THE BUILDING WAS FIRST OPENED AS A SCHOOL IN 1828 WITH EXTENSIONS ADDED AROUND 1950. AT PRESENT THERE ARE TWO TEACHERS AND THIRTY TWO PUPILS. THE CHILDREN COME FROM THE GLEN, TRAQUAIR, TOWFORD AND INNERLEITHEN WITH ONE FAMILY FROM WALKERBURN. THE SCHOOL BUS BRINGS CHILDREN FOR TRAQUAIR GLEN BUT CHILDREN FROM INNERLEITHEN & WALKERBURN MUST PROVIDE THEIR OWN TRANSPORT AS THEY ARE OUTWITH THE OFFICIAL CATCHMENT AREA. THE PUPILS GO ONE MILE TO ST. RONAN'S PRIMARY SCHOOL TO MAKE USE OF THE GYMNASIUM THERE AND FOR TWO OUT OF THREE TERMS PUPILS ARE TAKEN TO PEEBLES SWIMMING BATHS FOR SWIMMING/LIFE SAVING LESSONS. THE ONE LARGE CLASSROOM IS DIVIDED BY A WOODEN PARTION MAKING TWO ROOMS FOR LESSONS.
